snippet: Ana Miguel had recurring bouts of depression but doctors incorrectly diagnosed schizophrenia, and treated her for that. She got help from a new psychiatrist and has been accepted into a G.E.D. program.
abstract: Brooklyn Community Services, one of the seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund draws $150 to help Ana Miguel of East New York, who suffers from bipolar disorder, buy a winter coat.
lead_paragraph: Ana Miguel had recurring bouts of depression but doctors incorrectly diagnosed schizophrenia, and treated her for that. She got help from a new psychiatrist and has been accepted into a G.E.D. program.

headline.main: She Overcame Drugs and Instability, and Hopes to Help Others Do the Same
headline.print_headline: She Overcame Drugs and Instability, and Hopes to Help Others Do the Same

keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
keywords.name: organizations
